values: For those of you who did not see the previous memo, it's going out again. This journal is dying dying dead. Look to wreakjavik for further news of myself, assuming you care. Please note: I will not be, at least for a little while, adding people unless they add me first. I want to get an accurate measure of who actually reads and pays attention to all the stupid things I say on here. For those of you who did see the previous memo: Roz, Hanna, Lauren, Tommy, and Flavia. You are among my favoritest. But you probably already knew that. If all we dreamt was left aside to drift into the air - what would this life be but automatic motions put to stifled emotion? Iceland is on fire! Iceland is on fire! Viva wreakjavik wreakjavik: wreakjavik;

A funny thing happened to me Saturday night. After Murder by Death destroyed a great deal of the conscious thought center in my brain, I stood further back in the crowd to watch Lucero. I had my dad's digital camera with me, so I took a couple of blurry pictures. But since my brain was, like I said, very much destroyed, I didn't have the attention span to keep from getting distracted. And when my head is lolling around distracted at shows, I tend to watch and notice people. Especially girls, because old habits die hard and all. But the old habits aren't what I wanted to talk about. Of the people and, like I said, girls I noticed, and subsequently watched, there were two that didn't catch my attention more than any others. But this story is about them, or at least one of them, so I have to introduce them now. They were both thin, average height, shortish dark hair, dressed mostly in black. Nothing unheard of at a show, you might say. But I noticed these girls again when one of them, the one the story's about, turned and started walking in my direction, and when she walked straight up to me I looked right at her. And when she came right next to me and lifted her head, I bent down and put my ear towards her. You know, shows are loud and that's what you do. And while I waited for her whispered message to trickle down my ear, she kissed me on the cheek. Or the part of the face between the cheek and ear. I don't know if that part has a name or not. I turned to say something, or maybe just have her notice my stupefied, sheepish grin, but she was nearly out the door. And I turned and looked at her friend, and I asked with my grin "What the fuck just happened?" And she smiled and walked towards the stage, and disappeared into the crowd. Things like this don't really happen to me, you understand. So I walked over towards the ticket table where Jacq was working, and I didn't see this Mystery Kisser along the way. So I sat at the table and told her the story, and she let me know that that's weird for anyone, not just me. Sometimes I need to be told that. And we talked about how sexual Murder by Death's cellist plays, and what a tragedy it is that she is more than likely dating the singer. I showed Jacq the pictures I'd taken of the cellist, and in the process trying to figure out how the damn camera worked. During that time Lucero had finished, and the Weakerthans had been taking their time setting up.. I was sitting cross-legged on the table hunched over, poring over the camera's inch and a half screen and four little buttons, when the Mystery Kisser snuck up on me again. She said, "Hi, my name is Stephanie. I kissed you earlier." I said, "I remember that. Nice to meet you, my name's Steve." As soon as I'd said my name, my remaining faculties of conscious thought began to whir, and I noticed the similarities between our names. She said, "Would you like to come watch the Weakerthans with me?" I said, "Um, sure." She said, "I'm the Weakerthans' biggest fan, so don't be thrown off if I'm singing and dancing a lot." I told her I wouldn't be at all. I followed her to her friend's roost near the front of the stage, and we introduced ourselves further. Disclosing deep and personal information, like that she lives and goes to school in San Francisco, and studies Sociology. She introduced me to all her friends too, the ones who were roosting, but I honestly can't remember any of their names. And then the Weakerthans began playing. Have you ever watched someone watch their favorite band before? I highly recommend it. The unfettered joy of each note played exactly as they've heard it so many times before. The tenth of a second of pause at the beginning of each song, cross referencing that intro with their encyclopedic knowledge of the bands discography. The jumping, the dancing, the singing along. It's just so great to watch people be happy, to watch them have passion. And they faux-finished their set, because they knew they were going to have an encore and the crowd knew they were going to have an encore. And after a minimal of chanting to convince them, the Weakerthans returned to the stage, and Stephanie and I stood closer to the front of the stage. And they played this one song, I didn't know what it was called, because as I warned Stephanie I'm not particularly familiar with the Weakerthans, so I had to Google it to find exactly what the lyrics were. How I don't know what I should do with my hands when I talk to you. How you don't know where you should look, so you look at my hands. And at that exact moment in time, like two watches suddenly becoming synchronized, like a lunar eclipse, my left hand happened to be awkwardly floating in dead space between us. So I put it on her back. What would you have done? But I quickly took it away again, of course, because otherwise I wouldn't know how to explain myself to her. And how would I be able to explain that I was immeasurably grateful that she shared her love of this band with me. That she made my night just as much as seeing one of my top 5 or 10 favorite bands. That I was still completely aware of the fact that she was still a stranger. That I'd start downloading everything I could find by the Weakerthans immediately. That I greatly enjoyed this little time capsule but the last thing I wanted was for us to be half blind, club-handed, making out. That through the night, despite Mystery Kissing and Sexual Cello, my thoughts were fixed on another. So when the music ended for real, after the encore, and everyone knew it, I tapped Stephanie on the shoulder. And she turned to me, and I bent down and kissed her on that nameless place between the ear and the cheek. And I ran away. But I had managed to take a picture. Truth or fiction?

guess i haven't been going out or doing much recently. i'm too stressed out, and i'm not helping my own cause at all. even my own body knows what's going on, is pissed off, is rising up to mutiny against me. my right eyelid twitches involuntarily, out of control. i woke up horribly dizzy this morning. fluids constantly leak out my nose. i'm never hungry, and what i eat doesn't give me any energy. and the other day i swore my heart stopped working.

but then i'm walking home from school, and i'm in the middle of the fog, and it's so fucking awesome, like someone put a barbara walters fuzz lens on the world and now everything looks positively beautiful. except barbara walters. thank god i don't have to see her when i'm walking down the street.

if i said i wasn't happy, would that make it true? if i avoided saying it, would it make it less true? sometimes everything works, and sometimes it just doesn't, and these times are scarcely more than 5 minutes apart. what the hell is going on.


Jag er har for utbildning och politisk asyl. - my first phrase of swedish. i assume the grammar is downright terrible. hanna, give me a hand on this one.

post script: damn livejournal operating without unitype. imagine the vowels in 'har' and 'for' with umlauts. i've always theorized that an umlaut is an omelette with an umlaut over it. end tangent.

how come i can't get drunk, act like i'm happy, hook up with a whoever, and throw up on strangers' shoes? why does this not appeal to me at all? And, failing that option, what is supposed to make me happy? I wonder if people see me sitting there in the corner, not drinking, and mistake my detatchment for self-righteousness. I'm not social enough to be a social drinker. Do I hate parties because I hate people? I always say I hate people, but what if it's true? Finally, how the fuck are you supposed to meet girls who don't drink or at least, don't like alcohol-centric social events, in college? I have a suspicion there are some more people out there, who think like me, but they're shut in their rooms saturday nights too. Maybe they're writing in their stupid fucking journals too. Thursday was an amazing night. I drove to San Francisco, besting Rush Hour Traffic (minus jackie chan and benicio del torro) to see first Converge, then immediately after their set ended I shot off to the Bottom of the Hill for Do Make Say Think. Whenever I go to two widely differing events like that, I wonder if anyone else did too. I should think, if they also loved each band enough they'd never forgive themselves if they'd missed either one, that i would like to be their friend, based on that alone. Well, one person i know of went to both, my friend colin, who i ran into at the converge show and he decided to ride back with me so i wouldn't have to drive alone, even though he'd never heard DMST before. Official first rain was tonight. I missed out on the nakedness, but the rain was good enough.

I'd say they're the lex luthor to my superman, but i'm feeling evil and certainly not omnipotent, so i'll reverse those roles for now, as they are an institution of this mighty mighty government I am so bent on toppling, it seems. I then went to the tran's house and miguel joined us, we went to graduation and I saw some great people that I shall be overjoyed to spend the rest of this summer with. I then began the job hunt, going into just play music 3 days in a row looking for a fabled connection my dad was telling me about, almost a guaranteed in, only to have this in inform me that they do not hire for the summer. Wonderful. I then saw devon in his week back in town, and Mariko and her friend intercepted me on my way to his house and we all spent the day together. And I went to a spectacular 7 Seconds/Pipedown/Ver-sally show in SLO from which I still have bumps and bruises. Now I have spent a day back in Lompoc exchanging in a heap of clean laundry to repeat the process all over again: i'm planning on waking up in an hour and a half to go back to goleta, back to the dmv, back to the trans for some swim crew action, over to hang out with courtney and hopefully roz, and then the fucking since by man/plot show. Adventures will unfold. stay tuned PS. There's a reason besides insomnia I update so late.

Today I woke up and saw that the clock on my wall that has been broken for years has suddenly started working again. This can mean only one thing: it has resurrected itself and is now counting down the hours to the apocalypse. I walked across town to the lompoc DMV today to renew my permit, the same building in which I have failed the driver's test twice and not been allowed to take it once. It was closed. I hereby swear I will never return there without grenades, and should that day come I will indeed destroy it. It is a den of otherworldy evil visited upon the earth, a scourge whose only place is in hell. Walking home from the DMV I came across a man with an ice cream cart. I had seen him as I was walking there, I followed him for 3 blocks and he didn't make a single sale. So I decided to buy an ice cream sandwich, hoping to make both of our days better. Overcoming the enormous barrier of language I managed to indeed purchase an ice cream sandwich, and I unrapped it as I walked away and bit through the soft cookie outside. But not the ice cream, as it was apparently forged of a top secret government superalloy designed to not only destroy the teeth of angry people snubbed by the DMV but also as a replacement for kevlar in bulletproof vests. Instead of just becoming more angry, I marvelled at it my entire walk home. I also ate it...somehow. It was good. P.S. check my old bio on the reckless page because I knew it all along

The Monolatrist decided that in order to keep anything bad from happening in his life, he must believe in a God incapable of anything bad. Thus he prayed to the God of Cupcakes every evening before he went to bed. He prayed for a rain of cupcakes to fall from the sky and leave him in eternal bliss topped with white frosting and rainbow sprinkles. Six months later he decided the God of Cupcakes was the God of Emptiness and Despair in disguise, so he began to pray to the God of Ice Cream. But the God of Ice Cream turned out to be the God of Unfulfilled Dreams. The God of Pecan Pie was actually the God of False Dreams and the God of Nubile Young Women was the God of Shattered Hope. Finally, running out of harmless things to worship, the Monolatrist turned to the God of Water. And Lo, miraculously a fine rain of water swept from the heavens and down upon the land, and the Monolatrist thrilled at his current God's fidelity to him. He ran out into the middle of the street to stare at the sky and give thanks to his new Lord when the tidal wave swept him off his feet and carried him into the ocean. The Monolatrist drowned as a believer in the God of Cupcakes.

Fucking amazing. Everyone read it, right now. I also bought the new remastered Fanning the Flames of Discontent because i didn't have it and I needed it. I don't have anything more to say. the world is still a fucked up/amazing place. I love you, and I hate everyone else.

Well, i suppose I finally have to write about coachella, don't I?

jesus.

the entire adventure started in my philosophy class, 3 hours before my bus to sb left, when i finally decided not to try and sell my ticket.
on the way there i saw cool things, like a street named "foletta" in soledad or gonzales or some shit town. I also saw a van with "coachella or bust" written on the back. and then, the highlight of my day was this black dude in the salinas bus station asking me if i had any pot. got in to sb, saw my dad, that was cool.
friday, evan couldn't make the 3:00 departure due to the whole band+record label shizazz, so at around 6:30 roz came by and I GOT TO SEE ROZ! aw yaaay. and we went over to evan's, owen was already there, we all waited for him. i told roz dead baby jokes, and probably scarred her for life. finally around 8 we left to indio, and holy shit. i had good chinese food at a really neat restaurant along the way, and i got the most obvious fortune cookie ever. "you will find good fortune in love". duuuuh. Anyhow, we got to indio and those kids+the kids we met up with down there partied it up like it was coachella 2004, because it was. And I finally got to meet Roz's and Avian's boys. I approve.
Saturday! Weirdest day ever. actually, this whole thing was the weirdest weekend ever, but this was the pinnacle of weirdness. It all started with owen realizing he had forgotten his tickets. We went on, him scalping, through egregious heat into indio for the festival. I immediately split off from those homies...top 5 for the first day.
5) getting a hug from a random drunk lady. Or the (international) noise conspiracy, even though they played the exact same set i saw them play a few weeks ago. 
4) The Pixies. They were just really good.
3) Trail of Dead. They added a second drummer. They played an amazing set, including Intelligence which i didn't think they'd play. They are simply a great band.
2) MOTHERFUCKING TESLA COIL! For those of you who've never played C&C: Red Alert, a tesla coil is a tower that shoots lightning. And they had a real one at Coachella.
1) Radiohead. Oh my god, this was amazing, even though I was on the verge of collapsing from lack of food and water, and the motherfucking heat. In fact, maybe that made it even better.
So we get out of the festival and WTF evan's car wouldn't start! no batteries! after unsuccessful jumping attempts, we decide to deal with this the next day and all pile in harrison's car to get back to the hotel. I volunteered to ride in the trunk for the 30+ mile ride. It was way awesome. Then, we were so hungry we made our way to denny's for the second time in one day, though i hadn't ordered anything the first time. I hadn't eaten in probably 14 hours, so naturally we had to wait an hour before we got any food, though we were thankfully entertained by white trash superstars: a metalhead who said savage and appreciated 'double kickers' and a long haired freak who refered to a dude's cock as his 'dallywhacker'.
Sunday! We did it right, although we did miss !!!. that was way sad. top 5:
5) AIR. I don't get them yet, but when i did i was feeling it.
4) Mogwai. I only saw like 15-20 mins of their set, but it was so amazing, so intense, so fucking good.
3) Belle and Sebastian. This band really made it work. I have a whole new respect for them, and i need to listen to them more now. plus i fell in love with a girl in the crowd during their set.
oh well!
2) Broken Social Scene. Blew my mind. I really like the way they work their band, and have all their friends coming in and playing songs. They played that one song that i really like, the one i'm listening to right now...and then the guitarist proposed to his girlfriend on stage and it was so fucking beautiful.
1) Flaming Lips. Jesus, i could have sworn i was on drugs. 15 people in animal costumes dancing on stage. The singer descending from outer space in a giant bubble, then prancing about upon the crowd in it. fists of fury and nun puppets galore. definitely one of the best live shows i've ever seen, and i don't throw that around lightly.
Well we finally figured out evan's car, then spent a half hour to an hour in the parking lot rounding up everyone and finding harrison's car, and then we got out quite painlessly. We were locked out of our room, but used our magic powers and got in. me and evan watched some weird fucking tv shows back at the hotel, including a documentary on prostitution. swiping credit cards in buttcracks is scary, kids.
Monday! Farewell to the hotel! Everything was going fine, though owen was paranoid as fuck, until we got to summerland and ran out of gas, and had to push the car into the gas station. meanwhile my creative writing assignment was due shortly! thankfully I got it in on time, all thanks to jacq, who i now owe my soul to. My dad then took me to the restaurant he works at and bought me dinner, and it was super good. Finally at midnight it was time to get back on the bus and return to SC. Sleep did not accompany me on my journey, however, and the melatonin that was supposed to help it come about did nothing but make it so i couldn't do anything but sleep. so i was just miserable. oh yeah, and brendan from dp theater who goes to sc was on the bus too, also getting back from coachella. small world.

i got back to find melanie in my bed, and the rest of today unfolded in that manner. i got to see pretty much every single one of the great people i know up here. and i'm happy. goodnight.

I took a 4 am walk for the first time in a long time on saturday night/sunday morning, and it was wonderful, to say the least. i think i'm learning to figure out what i need to do to feel content, when to play guitar, when to read, when to walk, or move around, when to play video games, when to not be alone, dammit.

<strike>Speaking of being alone.</strike> No.

But really, those are a whole lot of solitary activities that I enjoy. Innnteresting. Anyway, the point remains, i am not finished destroying the world. Not by a longshot. More rocks.... I've been thinking a lot about mental illness lately. Wouldn't that suck? I think it would.

Oh yes, and then there's the coachella thing. Turns out i don't know how i'm getting there, or where I'm staying, after all. I am at a crisis, or maybe a crux. I like that word better. Sell or scramble? If someone could help, either with rides or to buy a ticket, i would owe you my soul.

School is simultaneously interesting and monotonous
I am monotonously simultaneous and interesting
Stuff is Interestingly monotonous and simultaneous.
I don't make sense
Flying monkey wang
Adieu.

10 minute poem about how i love my friends 123GO

It seems in tribute to the dearest friends i love
Displays of appreciation I've been lacking
And now comes the time to do what i've spoken of,
Those who do not receive this deserve a sacking
You'd be jealous of these friends, that or enamored
And if your reaction was to the contrary,
I'd assume you were stupid, stoned, dead, or hammered.
My dedication to them will never vary
And though i'd never dare to mention them by name
For fear of omitting some vital component
(Like attempting to make a computer mainframe
And ending up making a toaster with a dent)
All i can say is that i'm committed to you
And the times that we have yet to go through
